metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32222 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A cryptographic vulnerability exists on Node.js on linux in versions of 18.x prior to 18.40.0 which allowed a default path for openssl.cnf that might be accessible under some circumstances to a non-admin user instead of /etc/ssl as was the case in versions prior to the upgrade to OpenSSL 3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode108 - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
nodejs - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2').
